question: Hamas lose power in Gaza before February?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Hamas is no longer recognized as the primary governing authority in the Gaza Strip for any length of time between December 26, 2023, and January 31, 2024, 11:59 PM GMT+2. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

"Primary governing authority" is defined as Hamas having predominant political and military control in the Gaza Strip. In case of shared governance or significant disruptions, the group or authority with majority of control of the Gaza Strip will be considered the primary governing authority.

If at any point within the time window of this market Hamas is not recognized as the primary governing authority of the Gaza Strip, this market may immediately resolve to "Yes".

This market's resolution source will be a consensus of credible reporting.

question: SOL/ETH new high by Jan 31?
description:
This is a market about whether the SOL/ETH price according to Binance reaches a new recent high by January 31, 2024 11:59 PM ET.

If the SOL/ETH price is greater than .05538 (reached on December 25, 2023 ET) at any point between December 28, 2023 and January 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "Yes". Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be Binance (https://www.binance.com/en/trade/SOL_ETH) high prices for 1-day candles within this market's date range, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: OpenAI settlement with NYT by end of 2024?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if it is announced that OpenAI has reached a settlement with the New York Times over copyright infringement issues by December 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise this market will resolve to “No.”

The resolution source will be a consensus of credible reporting.

question: OpenAI settlement with NYT by March?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if it is announced that OpenAI has reached a settlement with the New York Times over the issues outlined in the "THE NEW YORK TIMES COMPANY v. TIMES MICROSOFT CORPORATION, OPENAI, INC., et al." (Case 1:23-cv-11195) case by March 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise this market will resolve to “No.”

The resolution source for this market will be a consensus of credible reporting.

question: NYT drop OpenAI case by March?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if it is announced the New York Times has dropped their case against OpenAI/Microsoft, "THE NEW YORK TIMES COMPANY v. TIMES MICROSOFT CORPORATION, OPENAI, INC., et al." (Case 1:23-cv-11195), by March 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise this market will resolve to “No.”

The resolution source for this market will be a consensus of credible reporting.

question: Will a world leader shit themselves before March?
description:
This market will resolve to yes if any president or prime minister defecates in their clothing in public by February 29, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be a consensus of credible reporting.

question: Will Trump say a racial slur before February?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald J. Trump is confirmed to have used a slur against race or ethnicity, between December 28, 2023 and January 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

A consensus of credible sources will be used to resolve this market.

question: Will Iran officially join the war before February?
description: This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran officially declares war on Israel by January 31, 2024 11:59 PM ET. Declarations of war must be clear, and explicit. The market will resolve to "No" if no such official declaration of war is made by the specified date. Note that Israel or Hamas declaring war is not considered toward this market's resolution. Further, if e.g. Hezbollah declared war, it will not satisfy a “Yes” resolution - only Iran itself declaring war will suffice.

Further, if e.g. Hezbollah declared war, it will not satisfy a “Yes” resolution - only Iran itself declaring war will suffice.

question: Will 2024 be better than 2023?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Ipsos Consumer Tracker's "Me Personally" measure on the "It was a (comparatively) really good year" chart for 2024 (ex: https://www.ipsos.com/en-us/americans-say-2023-was-good-year-and-think-2024-will-be-even-better) indicates that 2024 was a better year than 2023. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The yearly results for the Ipsos Consumer Tracker are usually published early in December of a given year. If Ipsos announces they will cease to release consumer tracker information, otherwise shuts down, or if the Consumer Tracker information for 2024 is not made available by January 31, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source for this market will be the Ipsos Consumer Tracker.

question: Will Trump appear on Maine primary ballot?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald Trump appears on the official ballot for the 2024 Maine Republican Primary. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Write-ins will not qualify to resolve this market to "Yes". Only if the ballots officially issued list Donald Trump as an option will this market resolve to "Yes", regardless of any court ruling about whether he can appear on the ballot or not.

The primary resolution source will be information from the Maine Republican Party and the 2024 Maine Republican Primary, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.
